dataset_id: Visible and Near-Infrared Leaf Reflectance Spectra, 1992-1993 (ACCP)
title: Visible and Near-Infrared Leaf Reflectance Spectra, 1992-1993 (ACCP)
summary: Visible/NIR reflectance spectra data for both fresh and dry leaf samples were collected to determine the relationship of foliar chemical concentrations with reflectance.

cmr.title: Visible and Near-Infrared Leaf Reflectance Spectra, 1992-1993 (ACCP)
cmr.summary: Visible/NIR reflectance spectra data for both fresh and dry leaf samples were collected to determine the relationship of foliar chemical concentrations with reflectance.
cmr.description: Visible/NIR reflectance spectra data for both fresh and dry leaf samples were collected to determine the relationship of foliar chemical concentrations with reflectance.

citation: Romero, A., I. Aguado, and M. Yebra. 2011. Estimation of dry matter content in leaves using normalized indexes and PROSPECT model inversion. International Journal of Remote Sensing. 33(2):396-414.

Bortolot, Z.J. and R.H. Wynne. 2010. A method for predicting fresh green leaf nitrogen concentrations from shortwave infrared reflectance spectra acquired at the canopy level that requires no in situ nitrogen data. International Journal of Remote Sensing. 24(3):619-624.
